resources.string: An immersive introduction to the world of rugby, setting the stage for your journey through this incredible sport. Narrated by Irish Rugby Legend Paul O\'Connell, this video will introduce you to the five core values of the game. Passion, Discipline, Integrity, Solidarity and Respect. With a 270\u00B0 production like this, make sure to stand close to the back wall to take it all in.

The International Rugby Experience (IRE) is a striking seven-story cultural institution located in Limerick\'s Georgian Quarter. Designed by Stirling Prize-winning Níall McLaughlin Architects, the building blends contemporary and historic architectural elements, honoring both the city\'s heritage and the global sport of rugby. Situated on a tight urban site, the IRE was conceived as a civic landmark rather than a traditional townhouse. Its red-brick facade, with a rhythmic arrangement of brick piers and recessed bays, echoes the detailing of local churches and Georgian buildings. A grand entrance portico welcomes visitors, providing a sheltered public gathering space that fosters community interaction, particularly on match days.Inside, the museum features a dynamic vertical journey, leading visitors through a sequence of diverse spaces—some intimate and enclosed, others expansive and daylit. The building culminates in a dramatic public hall on the top floor, offering panoramic views over Limerick, acting as a beacon visible from across the city. Vaulted ceilings and structural brick detailing are key design elements, metaphorically reflecting the physical forces of rugby.The building\'s design also prioritizes sustainability and structural integrity. Handmade clay bricks and red-pigmented pre-cast concrete ensure a seamless integration with Limerick\'s historic fabric. Additionally, interactive exhibitions, digital displays, and event spaces are distributed across its levels, enhancing the visitor experience.More than a museum, the IRE serves as a vital urban landmark, strengthening connections between Limerick\'s cultural sites, Munster Rugby, and the local community.

Across each of the floors of the building, you will come across these Legendary Encounters. They feature several players who embody the value associated with each floor in the building. Passion: Peter O\'Mahony, Siya Kolisi, Agustin Pichot, Lawrence Dallaglio, Phaidra Knight Discipline: Johnny Sexton, Antoine Dupont, Nigel Owens, Integrity: Joy Neville, John Eales Solidarity: Alun Wyn Jones, Conor Murray, Maggie Alphonsi, Pieter Steph Du Toit, Respect: Anthony Foley, Brian O\'Driscoll, Richie McCaw, Philippe Sella

Explore how rugby shapes communities and develops grassroots initiatives worldwide. Learn more about Rugby 7s in Fiji, the NZ Natives (Maori) Touring Side, the origins of the kicking tee, rugby\'s importance in mining communities in Wales
Interactive tablets showcasing grassroots rugby initiatives from around the world and the work they do. SOS Kit Aid, Child Fund Rugby, Mixed Ability Sport
Discover the origins and early development of several global rugby superstars such as Thierry Dusautoir, David Pocock, Owen Farrell, Ciara Griffin and Greg O\'Shea.

A showcase of historic rugby balls that tell the story of the game\'s evolution. Some of the iconic stars that have graced the International Rugby Experience include Brian O\'Driscoll, Bryan Habana, Sean Fitzpatrick, Francois Pienaar, Keith Wood, Paul O\'Connell
Master the art of handling the rugby ball with precision and control. Presented by Faf de Klerk
Develop your strength and technique for scrummaging, tackling, and rucking. Presented by Tadhg Furlong
Learn the essential running techniques for different positions and situations. Presented by Keith Earls
Perfect your kicking technique for various game situations. Presented by Jonny Wilkinson
Laws of the Game with Nigel Owens
Learn the laws of rugby through an audiovisual presentation with legendary referee Nigel Owens.
Test your knowledge of rugby laws by watching clips from the Rugby World Cup and coming to refereeing decisions based on your knowledge of the laws.
Discover which rugby position best suits your skills and attributes based on your results from the four key skill games on the floor: Handling, Kicking, Running and Strength & Technique.
Compare yourself to the heights of some of rugby\'s elite athletes such as Serge Blanco, Uini Atonio, Richie McCaw and Emily Scarratt

Understanding the importance of everyone involved in preparing the team in rugby. This interactive presentation focuses on the backroom team at Munster where you can learn more about the roles of the head coach, groundsman, physio, stadium director and nutritionist.
Discover what makes great rugby leaders and how they inspire their teams. This section features discussions on Jonny Wilkinson, Jim Telfer, Sir Ian McGeechan and Joe Schmidt.

Experience how teams work together during crucial moments in the game. In this immersive virtual reality game you will be running through a few basic passing drills as a unit. The game requires three players.

Explore the unique traditions and spirit of rugby teams through their locker rooms. In every second locker here there is a story about brotherhood and sisterhood within the sport of rugby. Learn more about the importance of Irish Unity in Sport from Jack Kyle, a legendary farewell to the great Jonah Lomu as well as a lifelong brotherhood between Ronan O\'Gara and Peter Stringer.

Discover the rich traditions and cultures of rugby clubs worldwide. On this wall, we have featured eight of the most iconic teams in world rugby: The Crusaders, The Barbarians, The British & Irish Lions, Llanelli RFC, Leicester Tigers, Toulouse, Munster, Richmond RFC

Interactive exploration of rugby\'s greatest national teams and their achievements. On these tablets you can learn more about the top teams in world rugby, their fanbases and the distinct cultures that form the rich tapestry of world rugby.

Track the global expansion and development of rugby through interactive displays. Using the interactive touchscreens you can view statistics on world rugby and watch a presentation detailing the growth of the game across the world from the humble beginnings of World Rugby (then the International Rugby Board) in the 1880s right through to the modern day.

Celebrating rugby\'s core values of unity and respect across nations. Here you can pick up the phones to listen to stories from across the world that highlight the bonds of respect that unify our global game. Featuring: Francois Pienaar, Willie John McBride, Malakai Fekitoa, John Eales
An immersive audio-visual experience showcasing international rugby\'s greatest teams with a four walled visual presentation accompanied by national anthems.

Experience the power and significance of the Haka in rugby. This 2:30 Presentation will explore the history and culture behind the Haka as well as featuring the iconic Haka which preceded the Rugby World Cup Final in New Zealand in 2011.

Explore Limerick\'s landmarks through an interactive QR-guided tour of the skyline. Scanning the QR codes will give you extra information on each of the landmarks and identify them in the Limerick Skyline

Honour wall celebrating the greatest legends of rugby. In the centre you can see all the criteria for selection to the International Rugby Experience Hall of Fame and each year identifies when that player first met one of the above criteria.

Digital collection preserving rugby\'s most legendary figures. These digital archives store information on all the members of the International Rugby Experience Hall of Fame. You can learn all about the players listed on the Wall of Fame in the Hall of Legends as well as select your own Dream XV and see how it stacks up against your friends\' and family\'s
